description: Dreaming of a magical world every night, the young Toramizu Ginta yearns to be able to go there. With only his friend Koyuki believing in his dreams, Ginta remains positive despite the slander he receives from others over his dreams. But his wishes are answered, as one day a large door appears in front of Ginta, summoning him to the land of MAR Heaven. In this land, the weapons known as ARMS exist. While initially Ginta greatly enjoyed the discovery of this magical world, he soon learns of the terrible wars that have once plagued MAR Heaven and the upcoming war that may soon appear.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Fairy Tale
tags.description: This work tells a fairy tale, centers around fairy tales, or is based on a classic fairy tale.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Werewolf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a werewolf.

node.description:
Married to [Jaxon C. Lee](https://anilist.co/staff/95871/)
Full name is Amanda Beth Winn-Lee
Resides in Los Angeles. Born in Houston, Texas

Originating from [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/), where he studied under [Ashida Toyoo](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/).

He made his debut as in-betweener on [Manga Nihon Emaki](https://anilist.co/anime/9856/) and became a key animator on [Cyborg 009](https://anilist.co/anime/4690/) but it was his work as animation director on the [Minky Momo](https://anilist.co/anime/518/) series that brought him recognition and he was asked to draw illustrations of Momo. Subsequently he became the character designer for the later OVAs.

In 1986 he made his debut as director on [Kyoushoku Soukou Guyver](https://anilist.co/anime/2293/). Following some more work as animator he switched to directing in the beginning of the '90s. He is nowadays affiliated with [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.

Members include [Yuri Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/365002/), Hitoshi Okamoto, [Nana Azuki](https://anilist.co/staff/365000/), and [Hirohito Furui](https://anilist.co/staff/225154/), with Nakamura leading on vocals.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/奥田誠治_(アニメーション演出家%29)

Seiji Okuda is a veteran anime director. He established Project Team Eikyuukikan, a collaboration of several animators, which was disbanded by him in October 2009. He continues to work freelance, mostly as storyboarder. He is also a member of the JAniCA.

_Note: Not to be confused with the producer [Seiji Okuda](https://anilist.co/staff/219343/)._
